XII.ii.2.D.1.b
.
Determining Ending Dates for Awards Involving a Child or Children
Use the table below to determine the ending dates for awards involving a child or children.
If the award is on behalf of …
Then …
a child or children
terminate the benefits effective the first day of the month in which the youngest child on the award reaches age 18, per
M21-1, Part XII, Subpart ii, 2.D.7
.
a child
that is incapable of self-support
do not show a termination date if the child is the only child on the award.
Notes
:
A child attains the age of 18 years the day preceding the anniversary date of their birth.  Therefore, a child born on July 1 is considered to have attained the age of 18 years on June 30, and the last date of entitlement for the child is May 31, requiring an ending date of June 1.
Use an earlier date in those cases in which an earlier termination date is certified by SSA for reasons such as death or marriage.
